channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Salesforce exec says rise of AI agents means ‘every job should be rethought’
item.description: AI agents can do tedious tasks better than people, allowing human talent to be refocused on more critical opportunities.

item.title: Ship crossings to the U.S. are being canceled. Trump’s latest threat won’t help.
Trump touts ‘planned partnership’ between U.S. Steel and Nippon Steel, signaling potential approval of Japanese company’s buyout bid
item.description: As recently as December, Trump said he was "totally against the once great and powerful U.S. Steel being bought by a foreign company.”

item.title: Markets dip after Trump threatens tariffs against Europe and Apple, sinking the iPhone maker’s stock by 3%
item.description: The president said he would issue a 50% tariff on the EU and a 25% tax on Apple in a pair of Truth Social posts.

item.title: Elon Musk’s DOGE is reportedly targeting the Census Bureau next. One expert says it’s likely to eliminate its survey about prison inmates
item.description: Researchers and users of federal data are grappling with broader concerns about the health of the U.S. statistical system.

item.title: Boeing strikes $1.1 billion deal with Justice Department over deadly 737 Max crashes—and must pay $445 million to victims’ families
item.description: Boeing will pay and invest more than $1.1 billion, including an additional $445 million for the crash victims’ families.

item.title: U.S. Steel shares surge 22% after Trump backs Nippon Steel partnership
U.S. Steel continues to rise after hours as Trump backs Nippon Steel partnership
Eight words investment advisers can’t use in marketing their services
Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang now wants to help his rivals succeed. He’s not crazy.
